subject: Education
title: Neuroplasticity: The Brain That Rewires Itself
description: A short lesson to help you apply Neuroplasticity: The Brain That Rewires Itself.

hook.text: A girl had half her brain removed at age 6. She graduated from college. The remaining half rewired to do everything.

buildup.text: Neuroplasticity means the brain physically changes in response to learning. New skills create new pathways.

climax.text: Plasticity means intelligence isn't fixed at birth. Every learning experience physically reshapes the brain.

punchline.text: Learning doesn't fill the brain. It physically rebuilds it.

quiz.question: What does neuroplasticity mean?
options: The brain physically changes in response to learning
